children.description: An issue related to a condition where increased load results in a Denial of Service

children.name: Inrush
children.description: An issue related to the sudden increase in load, but not sustained load

children.name: SingleCustomer
children.description: An issue related to the sudden increase in load caused by a single customer, but not sustained load

children.name: LackOFCapacity
children.description: The service lacked capacity to handle load

children.description: The service did not have an adequate retry strategy or implementation for when client's retry requests against it

children.name: Scaling
children.description: Related to increasing or decreasing capacity according to load

children.name: AutoscaleInsufficient
children.description: The service's current autoscaling practice or functionality is not sufficient to handle increasing load

children.name: NoAutoscale
children.description: The service does not automatically increase capacity when subject to increasing load

children.name: Throttling
children.description: The service does not properly throttle incoming requests, or does not behave properly when being throttled

children.name: BucketPerOperation
children.description: All operations MUST expose a normalized resource cost.

children.name: MissingDetection
children.description: The service lacked telemetry to know when it was throttling or being throttled

children.name: NoisyNeighbor
children.description: Excess load from one tenant negatively impacted another tenant despite having throttling

children.name: NonStandardApproach
children.description: Current throttling mechanism is not a token bucket based algorithm or is otherwise not developed using proven practices

children.name: NoOverride
children.description: All services MUST be able to override throttling behavior, to handle inrush (slowly dialing up overall capacity during recovery conditions), with specific capabilities for whitelisting/blacklisting operations and users/tenants/subscriptions/etc. via direct token replenishment or bypassing quota enforcement

children.name: NoSelectiveThrottling
children.description: Services need to be aware of upstream calling patterns, and whether successful user outcomes require a minimum sequence of operations.

children.name: NoThrottling
children.description: The service does not have any throttling of incoming requests

children.name: PunitiveThrottling​
children.description: All services MUST be able to handle non-uniformity in their user facing throttling scopes, in an appropriately scalable and manageable fashion

children.name: ScopesNotAlignedWithBlastRadius​​
children.description: All services need to align throttling scopes against the throttling blast radius to minimize impact of noisy neighbors, even within an individual customer scope (e.g. a single misbehaved script cannot lock a customer out of management of an entire subscription).

children.name: TarPit
children.description: Services must NOT implement “tar pit” throttling approaches, where they delay response for a period of time in order to reduce the volume of incoming work (or hold processing the request until the throttling period has passed).  Instead, services must be prepared to immediately respond with the appropriate throttling codes (e.g. 429) on a transient or enduring basis (blacklisting).

children.name: Throttled
children.description: The service was throttled, and did not handle it correctly

children.name: ThrottlingInsufficient
children.description: The service has throttling, but it is insufficient and there can be or was impact

children.name: WrongResponseCode
children.description: The service is not sending the correct response code when it is throttled or throttling clients
